title: Suspect arrested with smuggled cigarettes at BIA
byline: An individual has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for smuggling a total of 3,200 sticks of foreign-made cigarettes (16 cartons).

title: Ex-Minister Tiran Alles receives death threats
byline: Former Minister of Public Security Tiran Alles has allegedly received death threats over the phone from a notorious underworld figure.

title: Trump calls Musk’s new political party ‘ridiculous’
byline: US President Donald Trump has hit out at former close ally Elon Musk over the multi-billionaire’s plan to launch a new political party.

title: 12-hour water cut in several areas of Gampaha today
byline: A 12-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas in the Gampaha District today (07), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and provinces and in Kandy, Nuwara-Eliya, Galle and Matara districts today (07).

title: Senior civil servant Bradman Weerakoon passes away
byline: Former senior civil servant Bradman Weerakoon has passed away at the age of 94, according to family sources.

title: Death toll from Texas floods reaches 78; Trump plans visit
byline: The death toll from catastrophic floods in Texas reached at least 78 on Sunday, including 28 children, as the search for girls missing from a summer camp continued and fears of more flooding prompted evacuations of volunteer responders.

title: Sri Lanka Navy rescues four Indian fishermen in seas off Chilaw
byline: Sri Lanka Navy (SLN) personnel have rescued four Indian fishermen from a distressed fishing boat in the seas off Chilaw.

title: 120 persons nabbed during special police operation in Sabaragamuwa Province
byline: A total of 120 persons have been arrested on charges of various offenses during a special operation conducted in the Ratnapura, Embilipitiya, Seethawakapura and Kegalle Police Divisions in the Sabaragamuwa Province yesterday (06), police said.

title: Four rescued after being swept away by strong currents at Ettukala Beach
byline: Four people who went sea bathing at Ettukala Beach were rescued after being swept away by strong water currents.

title: Dozens leave Japan islands after nearly 1,600 quakes
byline: Dozens of residents have evacuated remote islands in southern Japan that have been shaken by nearly 1,600 quakes in recent weeks, the local mayor said Monday (Jul 7).

title: Ex-Minister Duminda Dissanayake further remanded
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake has been further remanded until July 15 by the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court in relation to the case filed over the recent discovery of a gold-plated T-56 firearm at an apartment complex in Havelock Town, Colombo, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: SC informed case filed over KDU medical degree admission decision can be settled amicably
byline: Attorneys representing petitioners and the respondents in the case filed by a group of students—seeking an interim injunction to prevent the implementation of a decision not to admit local students to study for a medical degree at the Kotelawala Defence University—informed the Supreme Court today (07) that the case could be settled amicably.

title: Trump threatens new tariffs on nations supporting ‘anti-American’ policies of BRICS group
byline: President Donald Trump has threatened new tariffs on any nation supporting “anti-American” policies of the BRICS group of emerging economies, as he announced tariff letters would be sent out to scores of countries from Monday, ahead of a key deadline.

title: Election Commission services suspended until further notice
byline: All e-services of the National Election Commission have been suspended until further notice.

title: Archaeologists unveil 3,500-year-old city in Peru
byline: Archaeologists have announced the discovery of an ancient city in Peru’s northern Barranca province.

title: “Every decision we make should be made with children in mind” – PM Harini
byline: When developing school infrastructure under the new education reforms, it is necessary to allocate higher financial support to schools in underprivileged areas in order to ensure their improvement, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has noted.

title: ‘Jurassic World Rebirth’ bites off $318 million at the global box office
byline: Dinosaur fatigue may be a theme in “Jurassic World Rebirth,” but moviegoing audiences don’t seem to have that reservation. The newest installment in the “Jurassic World” franchise ruled the Fourth of July holiday box office with a global, five-day launch of $318.3 million, according to studio estimates Sunday.

title: Petition filed over election of Seethawaka PS Chairman to be taken up at Appeals Court on 9 July
byline: The Court of Appeal today (07) ordered that the petition filed seeking the issuance of an interim injunction to prevent the holding of a secret ballot to elect the Chairman and Deputy Chairman of the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha, be taken up on July 9 to confirm the facts.

title: “Ignoring peoples’ language rights led to an arms struggle” - Justice Minister
byline: National unity cannot be established through slogans and by merely initiating infrastructure projects, Minister of Justice and National Integration Harshana Nanayakkara has stated.

title: Donald Trump delays tariff deadline to August 1
byline: The United States is close to finalizing several trade pacts in coming days and will notify other countries of higher tariff rates by July 9, President Donald Trump said on Sunday, with the higher rates set to take effect on August 1.

title: Two 10-year-old boys drown in Uma Oya
byline: Two boys, aged 10, have reportedly drowned in Uma Oya, Welimada, police said.

title: No decision has been made to restrict vehicle imports -CBSL
byline: No decision has been made to restrict vehicle imports, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has emphasised.

title: A Dy Commissioner of Inland Revenue Dept arrested for soliciting a bribe
byline: A Deputy Commissioner of the Inland Revenue Department has been arrested for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 50,000 from a businessman, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) said.

title: UK experts inspect F-35B fighter jet stuck in India for three weeks
byline: A 14-member team of engineers from the UK has begun assessing a state-of-the-art British fighter jet stuck at an airport in India for more than three weeks now.

title: Colombo HC issues summons on Keheliya over substandard drug imports case
byline: The Colombo High Court Special Trial-at-Bar has issued summons on former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella and 11 others to appear before court on 11 July, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: US dollar hits multi-year low as investors brace for Trump tariff deadline
byline: The dollar firmed against other major currencies on Monday, after remarks from U.S. officials offered little clarity on the outlook for tariffs, days ahead of a crucial deadline.

title: Election Commission e-services suspended until further notice
byline: All e-services of the National Election Commission have been suspended until further notice.

title: Govt to impose 18% VAT on cross-border digital services provided via electronic platforms
byline: The government will introduce an 18% Value Added Tax (VAT) on digital services provided by non-resident companies to local consumers, effective October 1, 2025.

title: Foreign reserves are not used for vehicle imports - Top economist
byline: Top economist Dhananath Fernando states that the country’s foreign exchange reserves are not used to facilitate the import of motor vehicles.

title: Tenders called for sale of 14 luxury vehicles by Energy Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Energy has called for tenders for the sale of 14 luxury vehicles under its ownership.

title: Russian minister dies by suicide hours after getting fired by Putin – reports
byline: Former Russian Transport Minister Roman Starovoit died by suicide on Monday, just hours after Russian President Vladimir Putin fired him from the job, officials said.

title: Nishantha Jayaweera appointed to Harshana’s MP seat
byline: The Election Commission of Sri Lanka has issued a Gazette notification confirming that Ushettige Don Nishantha Jayaweera has been elected as a Member of Parliament through the National List of the National People’s Power (NPP).
